de.boereck.matcher.helpers

Class CollectionMatchHelpers

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.boereck.matcher.helpers.CollectionMatchHelpers

  • public class CollectionMatchHelpers
extends Object
    This class provides static helper methods for matching collection objects.

    • Field Summary

    • Field Detail

      • notEmpty

        public static final AdvPredicate<Collection<?>> notEmpty
        Predicate checking if a collection is not null and not empty.

      • rawNotEmpty

        public static final AdvPredicate<Collection> rawNotEmpty
        Predicate checking if a collection is not null and not empty.

      • castToCollection

        public static final OptionalMapper<Object,Collection<?>> castToCollection
        References a function that takes an Object and checks if the object is instance of Collection. If so, the function will return an Optional with the input object casted to Collection. Otherwise the function will return an empty Optional.

    • Method Detail

      • $

        public static <T> Stream<T> $(Collection<T> c)
        This method is a shortcut for c.stream() if c is not null. If c is null, this method will return an empty stream.
        Type Parameters:
        T - Type of elements in collection.
        Parameters:
        c - Collection to create a Stream from. If null, an empty stream will be returned.
        Returns:
        Stream created from collection c.

      • filter

        public static <I,O> Stream<O> filter(Collection<I> c,
                                     Class<O> clazz)
        Shortcut for filter($(c),clazz)
        Type Parameters:
        I - type of input elements
        O - type of output elements
        Parameters:
        c - collection to be filtered
        clazz - filter type of elements that will remain in the returned Stream
        Returns:
        Stream of elements in collection c that are of type O

      • filter

        public static <I,O> Stream<O> filter(Stream<I> s,
                                     Class<O> clazz)
                              throws NullPointerException
        This is a shortcut for (Stream<O>) s.filter(o -> clazz.isInstance(o)).
        Type Parameters:
        I - Type of elements in input stream
        O - Type of element remaining in the output stream
        Parameters:
        s - stream that's elements are filtered by type clazz. Must not be null.
        clazz - Type the elements of the input stream should be of to be part of the returned result stream. Must not be null.
        Returns:
        input stream filtered by type O
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - when clazz or s is null.

      • filterCollection

        public static <I,O> OptionalMapper<Collection<I>,List<O>> filterCollection(Class<O> type)
                                                                    throws NullPointerException
        Returns a function filtering an input collection and returning the elements from the source collection filtered by the given type in a new List. The optional returned by the resulting function will be empty if the input collection is null, or the input collection contains no element instance of type. If at least one element of the input collection is instance of type, the output optional will hold a list of all elements of the input collection instance of type.
        Type Parameters:
        I - element type of input collection
        O - element type of output list
        Parameters:
        type - class that input elements are filtered by. Must not be null.
        Returns:
        function filtering the input elements by the given type.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if type is null.

      • filterCollection

        public static <I> OptionalMapper<Collection<I>,List<I>> filterCollection(Predicate<I> test)
        Returns a function filtering an input collection and returning the elements from the source collection matching predicate test in a new List. The optional returned by the resulting function will be empty if the input collection is null, or the input collection contains no element conforming to predicate test. If at least one element of the input collection is conforming test, the output optional will hold a list of all elements of the input collection matching test.
        Type Parameters:
        I - element type of input collection
        Parameters:
        test - predicate that input elements are filtered by. Must not be null.
        Returns:
        function filtering the input elements by the given predicate test.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if test is null.

      • toNonEmptyList

        public static <I> Collector<I,?,Optional<List<I>>> toNonEmptyList()
        This method returns a Collector for Streams, returning an Optional of a list of all the elements that are part of the stream. If the list is empty (no element left in the stream), the optional will be empty, otherwise it will contain the list with the collected elements of the stream.
        Type Parameters:
        I - Type of elements in stream
        Returns:
        Collector, returning either an empty optional, if the stream it is used on does not contain elements, or an optional holding the list of collected elements, if there were elements in the stream.

      • findCount

        public static <T> Found findCount(Collection<T> c,
                                  Predicate<? super T> p)
                           throws NullPointerException
        This method traverses the collection and checks how many elements in that collection are tested positive with the given predicate. Depending on the result, a subclass of Found will be returned. This will either be FoundAll, FoundNone or FoundSome. Be aware that under the covers java stream APIs may be used.
        Type Parameters:
        T - Type of elements of c.
        Parameters:
        c - collection that will be traversed and elements checked for predicate p.
        p - Predicate, every element from c is checked with. Must not be null.
        Returns:
        Found instance, based on how many elements in c pass predicate p.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - will be thrown if p is null.

      • contains

        public static <I,T extends I> AdvPredicate<Collection<I>> contains(T t)
        Returns a predicate checking if a collection contains the value passed in as parameter t. The predicate will return false if the collection passed to the returned predicate is null.
        Type Parameters:
        I - Type of elements in the checked collection
        T - Type of the object that is checked to be in a collection
        Parameters:
        t - element that is checked to be in a given collection by the returned predicate.
        Returns:
        A predicate checking if object t is in a given collection.

      • count

        public static <I> TestableToLongFunction<Collection<I>> count(Predicate<? super I> p)
                                                       throws NullPointerException
        Returns a function that counts how many elements of an input collection are tested positive with the given predicate p. If the input collection is null, the returned count will be 0.
        Type Parameters:
        I - Type of elements in the input collection
        Parameters:
        p - used to check how many elements in the input collection match this predicate.
        Returns:
        function that counts how many elements of an input collection are tested positive with the given predicate p. If the input collection is null, the returned count will be 0.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - will be thrown if p is null.

      • findCount

        public static <I> TestableFunction<Collection<I>,Found> findCount(Predicate<? super I> p)
                                                           throws NullPointerException
        This function returns a function that tests if and how many elements in a collection match the given predicate p.
        Type Parameters:
        I - Type of elements in input collection
        Parameters:
        p - Predicate that is used to check for elements in a given collection. Must not be null.
        Returns:
        Function counting the elements of an input collection that are tested positive with the given predicate p.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if p is null

      • findCountExisting

        public static <I> OptionalMapper<Collection<I>,Found> findCountExisting(Predicate<? super I> p)
                                                                 throws NullPointerException
        This method returns a function that returns an optional of Found, that holds a value, if elements were found, and an empty optional, if no elements were found that match predicate p.
        Type Parameters:
        I - Type of elements of input collection to be checked.
        Parameters:
        p - used to check how many elements match this predicate. Must not be null.
        Returns:
        Function that returns an optional of Found, that holds a value, if elements were found, and an empty optional, if no elements were found that match predicate p.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if p is null.

      • exists

        public static <I> AdvPredicate<Collection<I>> exists(Predicate<? super I> p)
                                              throws NullPointerException
        Returns a predicate that checks if a collection is not null and contains an element that matches the predicate p.
        Type Parameters:
        I - Types of elements in the collection to be checked by the returned predicate.
        Parameters:
        p - predicate that will be used to check if an element of a given collection matches. Must not be null.
        Returns:
        Predicate that checks if a collection is not null and contains an element matching the predicate p.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if p is null

      • Ǝ

        public static <I> AdvPredicate<Collection<I>> Ǝ(Predicate<? super I> p)
        Redirect to method exists(Predicate).
        Type Parameters:
        I - Types of elements in the collection to be checked by the returned predicate.
        Parameters:
        p - predicate that will be used to check if an element of a given collection matches. Must not be null.
        Returns:
        Predicate that checks if a collection is not null and contains an element matching the predicate p.

      • filterExists

        public static <I> OptionalMapper<Collection<I>,List<I>> filterExists(Predicate<? super I> p)
                                                              throws NullPointerException
        Returns a function from collection to an optional of collection, containing the elements of the input collection filtered by predicate p, if such elements exists. Otherwise the method will return an empty optional.
        Type Parameters:
        I - type of elements in input collection
        Parameters:
        p - is used to check if an input collection contains elements that pass this predicate.
        Returns:
        function filtering element of input collection by predicate p returning an optional that holds the filtered elements, if such elements exist.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - will be thrown if p is null.

      • forAll

        public static <I> AdvPredicate<Collection<I>> forAll(Predicate<? super I> p)
                                              throws NullPointerException
        Returns a predicate that checks if a collection is not null and all its elements found the predicate p.
        Type Parameters:
        I - Types of elements in the collection to be checked by the returned predicate.
        Parameters:
        p - predicate that will be used to check if all elements of a given collection matches. Must not be null
        Returns:
        Predicate that checks if a collection is not null and contains an element matching the predicate p.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if p is null

      • Ɐ

        public static <I> AdvPredicate<Collection<I>> Ɐ(Predicate<? super I> p)
                                         throws NullPointerException
        Redirect to method forAll(Predicate).
        Type Parameters:

      • elementsOfType

        public static <I,O> OptionalMapper<Collection<I>,List<O>> elementsOfType(Class<O> clazz)
                                                                  throws NullPointerException
        Returns a function mapping from a collection to an optional of a list. The optional will contain the list of elements in the collection that are instance of O. If the input collection does not contain any element that is instance of O, an empty optional will be returned from the function.
        Type Parameters:
        I - Element type of input collection
        O - Element type of output list
        Parameters:
        clazz - Class of type O, used to checke if elements of input collection are of this type. Must not be null.
        Returns:
        Function performing a filtered map to list holding all elements of the input collection that are instance of O.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if clazz is null

      • castToCollection

        public static <I> OptionalMapper<I,Collection<?>> castToCollection()
        References a function that takes an instance of I and checks if the object is instance of Collection. If so, the function will return an Optional with the input object casted to Collection. Otherwise the function will return an empty Optional.
        Type Parameters:
        I - Type I element is of that should be checked if it is instance of Collection.
        Returns:
        Mapper function checking if an object, instance of I, is not null and instance of Collection. If so, the mapper will return an Optional of the input object casted to Collection, otherwise it returns an empty Optional.

      • castToList

        public static <I> OptionalMapper<I,List<?>> castToList()
        References a function that takes an instance of I and checks if the object is instance of List. If so, the function will return an Optional with the input object casted to List. Otherwise the function will return an empty Optional.
        Type Parameters:
        I - Type I element is of that should be checked if it is instance of List.
        Returns:
        Mapper function checking if an object, instance of I, is not null and instance of List. If so, the mapper will return an Optional of the input object casted to List, otherwise it returns an empty Optional.

      • castToMap

        public static <I> OptionalMapper<I,Map<?,?>> castToMap()
        References a function that takes an instance of I and checks if the object is instance of Map. If so, the function will return an Optional with the input object casted to Map. Otherwise the function will return an empty Optional.
        Type Parameters:
        I - Type I element is of that should be checked if it is instance of Map.
        Returns:
        Mapper function checking if an object, instance of I, is not null and instance of Map. If so, the mapper will return an Optional of the input object casted to Map, otherwise it returns an empty Optional.

      • hasValueFor

        public static <K,V> OptionalMapper<Map<K,V>,V> hasValueFor(K key)
        Returns a function that takes a map and returns an optional, holding the value associated with the given key, or an empty optional, if the input map is null or there is no value or a null value associated with the key.
        Type Parameters:
        K - Type of key of the input map
        V - Type of value of the input map
        Parameters:
        key - Be aware that it depends on the implementation of the input map if null keys are allowed or not. This method will not check if this parameter is null or not.
        Returns:
        Function returning a non-empty Optional with the value of the input map that is associated with the given key key. If the input map does not hold a value for the given key, or the value is null, the Optional returned from the function will be empty.

      • isCollection

        public static <I> TypeCheck<I,Collection<?>> isCollection()
        Returns a Predicate checking if an input object of type I is not null and instance of Collection.
        Type Parameters:
        I - type of object to be checked if instance of Collection
        Returns:
        predicate checking if input object is instance of Collection.
